nn.core

Class SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • nn.core.NeuralNetwork
      • nn.core.FeedForwardNeuralNetwork
        • nn.core.SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork

  • public class SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
extends FeedForwardNeuralNetwork
    A SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork is a single-layer feed-forward network where all the inputs are directly connected to the outputs. (AIMA Section 18.7.2)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected InputUnit[] inputs 
      protected NeuronUnit[] outputs

      • inputs

        protected InputUnit[] inputs

      • outputs

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork

        public SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork(InputUnit[] inputs,
                                           NeuronUnit[] outputs)
        Construct and return a new SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork with the given InputUnits for inputs and NeuronUnits for outputs. It's up to you to arrange the feed-forward connections between the Units properly.

    • Method Detail

      • getInputs

        public InputUnit[] getInputs()

      • getOutputs

        public NeuronUnit[] getOutputs()

      • dump

        public void dump()
        Print this SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork to stdout. All we need to print are the weights on the output units.

      • train

        public void train(java.util.List<Example> examples,
                  double alpha)
        Train this SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork on the given Examples, using given learning rate alpha. This means updating the weights on the output units for each example on each step.
